text:
my name is Vicky and I was conceived by
rape

I was born in Birmingham in the 70s and
adopted when I was 7 months old growing

up I always wanted to find my birth
mother it's almost like she'd been a

ghost in my life knowing there was
somebody who given birth to you he was

alive walking around when I hit my 18th
birthday I was determined to get the

files and that's when I was told by a
social worker and I saw in black and

white in my files that my conception was
a result of rape

my birth mom had been 13 a school girl
and my birth dad a family friend he was

35 the record said that she'd gone to
babysit his house and he raped her to

find out that you've been born through a
horrendous act of violence against a

child and that people knew it says in
seven different places in the files that

it was rape the fact that she was 13
means it was statutory rape because he

had sex with a minor
it states his name and address

that social services police and health
workers knew but nothing was done about

it my birth mom was from a black
working-class family and I can't help

thinking attitudes at the time had
something to do with that it made me

feel angry devastated for my birth mum
for me and then I remember thinking will
my birth mother ever want to meet me

I traced my birth mother with support
from my adoptive father and I found her

seeing the photo of her for the first
time was incredible
it was like looking into a mirror I

remember us meeting when I was about 20
I walked off the train and she was there

I can only imagine how she must have
felt seeing me there as an adult she

said that she'd always hoped I find her
but it wasn't some soft focused moment

or loving embrace it was just was just
really surreal

it wasn't until decades later when the
Jimmy Savile case and other historic

cases were in the news that I really
thought about trying to do anything

about it I'd always thought it was so
wrong that my birth father was never

prosecuted
it was then though I thought I've got
DNA evidence because I am DNA evidence

I'm a walking crime scene and it's all
written in the files I mean surely

people are going to take me seriously I
wanted him to be held accountable I

wanted justice for my mom I wanted
justice for me the ramifications of what

he chose to do have shaped my entire
life

you think I'd get sick of Crying and he's
being able to get away with it and just
live his life

my birth mother made it very clear that
she reported that it was a rape at the

time and people hadn't listened to her
then so why would they listen now more

than 40 years have passed and she well
she doesn't want to go through all again

but she supports me pursuing it I've
contacted so many people police social

workers solicitors MPs they just say
you're not the victim because of that

crime I am Alive my whole life's been
dictated by it but no one will see me as

the victim I am living breathing proof
of a child rapist and nobody is
interested how is that okay

my birth father's name was in my files
so I traced him I was getting nowhere of

the police eventually I decided to go to
his address I just remember the nerves

my heart was pounding I was sweating I
mean this man like a ghost he's done the

most heinous act and this is who I'm
going to meet he came to the front door

and I just said hello I believe I'm your
daughter he just said oh come in and

that's it
it was the most surreal 40 minutes of my

life I remember saying to him well did
you have sex with her because if you

didn't then we don't need to be having
this conversation and he just said that

just because you have sex with somebody
doesn't mean you make a baby and so to

me that was well he just confirmed it
why would you not deny it on the way out

I noticed his photo on the wall of a
girl maybe about 12 years old I just

sort of said oh no who's that
it was his great-granddaughter or

someone and that made me feel absolutely
sick I mean who's protecting her

I found out that there have been
victimless prosecutions for rape when

people don't feel able to report it
because of the nature of the crime but

there's evidence I want the police to
look at the files and at least consider

a victimless prosecution in my case and
I want the definition of victim to be

reviewed this has nearly beaten me down
being adopted comes of so many

difficulties and the trauma of this has
affected every part of my life but I

will persevere because I know this is so
wrong and I want justice so I'm not
going to go away
